We need to make this look pretty (nice description) and also make it unable to be reordered by users.

Also see JRA-4690.
fields.summary: IssueCreateFunction not pretty and can be reordered

fields.description: At the moment you can't edit the create transition (for example adding your own post functions).
fields.summary: Allow create transition to be edited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4689].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 13 Jan 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days.

This suggestion is important for the JIRA development team, but we have not scheduled work and cannot provide an estimate on when it will be released. We will update this issue as soon as we can confidently project a release.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Daniel Franz
dfranz@atlassian.com
Principal Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
  

It would be good to have a 'boolean' custom field type, represented as a single checkbox.
fields.summary: Boolean custom field type

fields.description:
On the Browse Projects page, within the 'Project Information' tab panel, if components are hidden the version information appears right aligned.

Would look better if table included logic for hidden components and displayed version info without space.
fields.summary: Browse Project: Within the tab panel, if components are hidden - the version info appears to be right aligned.

fields.description:
I saw this error before and I thought I saw a bug saying it was now fixed. However, after installing the beta, doing some configuration, then clicking on the default dashboard under admin/global settings the portlet names in the left and right column lists were wrong (all appeared as {parameters['listValue']}) and exceptions were thrown on the catalina.log. Lots of exceptions, all appearing to be the same basic stack trace. Here's a snippet:

Sep 28, 2004 8:57:34 PM webwork.util.ValueStack findValue
SEVERE: METHOD: "property", exception:
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)

and

Sep 28, 2004 9:02:40 PM webwork.util.ValueStack findValue
SEVERE: METHOD: "text", exception:
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor60.invoke(Unknown Source)
        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
        at webwork.util.ValueStack.findValue(ValueStack.java:429)

and

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.util.PropertyResourceBundle.handleGetObject(PropertyResourceBundle.java:103)
        at java.util.ResourceBundle.getObject(ResourceBundle.java:308)
        at java.util.ResourceBundle.getString(ResourceBundle.java:274)
        at webwork.action.ActionSupport.getText(ActionSupport.java:324)
        at com.atlassian.jira.action.JiraActionSupport.getText(JiraActionSupport.java:154)
        at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.JiraWebActionSupport.getText(JiraWebActionSupport.java:408)


-wc
fields.summary: Configure Default Dashboard - portlet description wrong ({parameters['listValue']}, exception thrown

fields.description: We have a failure on creating an Issue. We have a numeric custom field called "effort" which is for our internal time tracking, but not important. We have a default value of "0,25" which represents 15 minutes or so. But when we submit the form, there occures a error "Invalid number" for the custom field(worked for 2.6.1). if we change the value to "0.25", it works(in the create issue form). So i tried to change the default value to "0.25" (so it ought to work). But the default value didnt change and we still get the error on creating issues.You got a clue? (sorry for my english, but i just got home from a party ;-) )
fields.summary: Invalid number in numeric field

fields.description: It appears that in JIRA 2.6.1, it is possible for an issue's workflow links ('Resolve', 'Close', 'Reopen' etc) to disappear for all users, regardless of which permissions they have.
fields.summary: Issue workflow transition links gone

fields.description:
The JIRA mail service extracts attachments from mails it reads, and adds them as issue attachments.  Apparently this parsing breaks on Oracle if attachments are over 32k, and probably also 4k (see JRA-4361):

fields.summary: Parsed mail attachments size limited to 4k using Oracle

fields.description:
The Browse Project page should not display the Tab panel (with Open Issues, Road Map, Change Log, etc.) if there is nothing to show.

If 'Fix Versions' and 'Components' have been hidden in an associated field layout scheme - the tab panel will not display any information.

Also, the 'Select' link on the tab panel should not be shown if there is no information to display.
fields.summary: Browse Project : Do not display tab panel if there is nothing to show.

fields.description:
We should allow the user to take any filter, and allow the users to group by a certain field.

This is similar the the statistic portlet, but listing the issues rather than just listing a total.
fields.summary: Group-by report

fields.description:
when we try to add a new user, we have to enter a dummy password. although it says it is not mandatory, it doesnt add the user without password. it says "when no password is entered one will be created randomly" but doesnt... 

so, say "123456" as password and create user. that password is not used as long as LDAP Active directory is used, and the user exists in LDAP, since the password in LDAP will be used to authonticate the user.
fields.summary: Have to enter password when creating users
Separate "set fix version" permission

fields.description:
At the moment every created workflow transition throws "Generic Event" - this is really a bit crap as we can't delete that workflow function, nor edit it, nor add another event (bad idea anyway).

We really need to be able to edit which event is thrown (even from the list of system defaults) so that people can at least have some control over their notifications.
fields.summary: Can't set which event is thrown by workflow transition

fields.description:
Add option to the two dimensional portlet to say "Display Totals? Yes/No" (select box). 

Default is NO - like now.

If user selects YES - display totals of the rows and column figures (linked when linking is done). Total columns should probably have diff background colour (light yellow would work)
fields.summary: Metricians want totals! :)

fields.description: Currently you can delete a workflow, even though it's used as a part of a scheme (if both are inactive). This seems a bit weird?
fields.summary: Can delete a workflow that's attached to a scheme?

fields.description:
The affects versions should have released versions first, then unreleased versions.

This has _always_ pissed me off - it's a 5 minute fix - can we fix it for 3.0 final?
fields.summary: Affects version/s in wrong order

fields.description: This would seem to me to be the most frequently used choice, hence the sensible default.
fields.summary: Make assign and comment default workflow view

fields.description:
At the moment there is no indicator as to why certain statuses aren't deletable. 

We should put an "Active" YES/NO column (like workflows) to indicate to users why they can't delete certain statuses.

Also, it's hard to see the workflows that a status is currently used in. I suggest moving this into it's own column?
fields.summary: Hard to tell why statuses aren't deletable

fields.description:
When velocity generation fails, the report result page starts with "An error occurred whilst sending this email."

That's confusing, I wnated to display a report, not send an email.
fields.summary: Confusing error message when velocity fails with report plugin

fields.description: Add a header to the "Browse Projects" page - as is done throughout JIRA - breifly describing what the page is displaying.
fields.summary: Add header to "Browse Projects" page.

fields.description:
The properties files for alternate language have less properties defined that the ones for default (master) language.

For example, in atlassian-jira-enterprise-3.0-beta-standalone/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib, the file com/atlassian/jira/web/action/user/ChangePassword.properties (from language_default.jar) have the following content:

changepassword.desc = Enter your new password details below.
changepassword.current = Current Password
changepassword.new = New Password
changepassword.confirm = Confirm Password

changepassword.current.password.incorrect = The current password specified is incorrect.
changepassword.could.not.find.user = Could not get current user to authenticate.
changepassword.new.password.required = The new password cannot be blank.
changepassword.new.password.confirmation.does.not.match = The password and confirmation do not match.


while the file com/atlassian/jira/web/action/user/ChangePassword_fr.properties (from language_fr_FR.jar) have the following:

changepassword.desc = Saisissez votre nouveau mot de passe ci-dessous.
changepassword.current = Mot de Passe Courant
changepassword.new = Nouveau Mot de Passe
changepassword.confirm = Confirmer Nouveau Mot de Passe

Because of this, many strings are not yet translated (in french at least).

Do you have a script that compares the property keys defined in language_default.jar and adds the ones missing in language_*.jar into them ?
fields.summary: Language properties files out-of-sync with master (language_default.jar)

fields.description:
When the mail queue is sending, we see the following:

"The mail queue is sending, it started sending at ."

ie there is no timestamp.

Its possible that there are some race conditions in the jsp and WW Action implementation...

The jsp first does a check to see if isSending - then calls the getPrettySendingStartTime.

A possible isssue is that getPrettySendingStartTime calls isSending again - which may return false at this time...

At the very least, there needs to be some atomicity about this double-poke.
Also, there needs to be some synchronisation on the MailQueue implementation itself...
fields.summary: When mail queue is sending, the UI shows inconsistant information

fields.description:
There are some places where a text string is assembled from single words or phrases. Because the assembly is hardcoded, it is difficult to translate because the grammar does not match. English sentences often start with the verb, whereas german sentences start with the subject.

Example:

english string: Browse users, groups or create a new user.
german string should be: Benutzer oder Gruppen anzeigen, oder neuen Benutzer anlegen.

It is difficult to let the german text start with the verb and it sounds awkward.

Suggestion: Use one property for each URL like this:

portlet.admin.users = Benutzer
portlet.admin.users.users = {0}Benutzer{1} oder
portlet.admin.users.groups = {0}Gruppen{1} anzeigen, oder
portlet.admin.users.createnew = neuen {0}Benutzer anlegen{1}.

There are other places with similar problems, will add them here when I find them.
fields.summary: some text has hardcoded structure

fields.description:
This has been around since the beginnings of the 3.0 previews, and thought it was fixed but just saw it in the 3.0 beta install.  I don't hit it too often since I don't edit old versions.

fields.description:
If you've been logged on for a while, if you do nothing your session will timeout.  This manifests itself in that your active search and active project will no longer appear.

If you go to browse a project directly, like /browse/PS, you will see a standard project view.  If you then click the "Critical" link to show the couple of bugs with that state, you will get an error message that you do not have a project selected.

Note that I can go back to the project overview page and reload many times, so its not a function of the browser caching it.

This bug has been around since 2.6.1 days, but it's easy to work around (go to the list of projects, and pick the project), or actually what I usually do is skip the project page and just use a project stat portlet to break down my issues.  But since that was broken for the 3.0 release and isn't planned until 3.1, I'm stuck going through the browse project interface again.

Anyway, once more, you'll see in this attachment that it seems other critical session information is missing since the decorator is broken with just scripting.  Hopefully this bug explanation and screenshot will help and make some sense.
fields.summary: Browse project does not update session's project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4619].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to highlight that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage. We'll be reworking notifications entirely in the future, but as this is not marked to begin in the next 12 months we feel it isn't the right thing to do to commit to any timeline.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

Currently custom fields are not displayed in emails.  We should have another template that each custom field can use to display itself inside an email.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4618].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 3rd December 2013|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,

Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this feature request.

Good news, Everyone. Your waiting is about to end. 

Even though we had no plans to put the work related to this feature on our short term roadmaps, the solution was implemented as a result of "20% projects" effort and is currently being tested. You can read about our "20% projects" here: [Life at Atlassian|https://www.atlassian.com/company/careers/life].

The plan is to make this feature available with the next release of JIRA, which is targeted for the first quarter of calendar year 2014. 

Thanks for your patience and we hope you appreciate our open approach to feature requests.

Regards,

Roy Krishna & Bartek Gatz
roy (at) atlassian (dot) com & bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
JIRA Product Managers
{panel}
\\
*Original request description:*

When a user creates an issue and sets the reporter to someone else, there is no record in the issue of who originally created the issue.  We should record the actual reporter in the changelog.
fields.summary: When reporter differs from creator, the creator should be recorded in change history

fields.description:
At least 2 people have run into problems with csv import due to not formatting the csv file as follows:

Each line in the csv file needs to include a column for all fields including fields for which you don't actually have a value. The following is an example line from a correctly formatted csv:
 
"NP-10","Issues Tracking","A way of tracking planning issues that is more manageable than an ever growing document listing everything we've ever thought of.","Robot","25/07/2004  12:00:00 AM","Robot","Open","Medium","Bla"," "," "," "," "," "," "," "
 
Note all the instances of " " at the end.

I'd suggest either:

- making the cvs import tool more tolerant wrt to the format of the csv file, or
- simply update the documentation of the tool to include the above details
fields.summary: Format of file for csv import is not defined sufficiently in documentation

fields.description:
Users want to restrict access to custom fields. Some custom fields are used internally and should not be visible outside the company. 

A solution might be: The custom field creation page has additional fields, where one can enter groups, users etc. for read permission and maybe a second field for write permission.

Related to: JRA-1330, which is more general but needs much more effort to implement.
fields.summary: access permissions for custom fields

fields.description:
I have a filter with global sharing, which has a subscriber. If I delete this filter, I get this text: Deleting this filter will not alter any subscriptions, as there are 0 subscriptions associated with it. 

Which is incorrect, since there is another subscriber.

I expected that I get a warning not to delete the filter because there are subscribers.

Also, the page "View Subscriptions for ..." should list all subscriptions, not just my own, at least if I am the author of the filter.
fields.summary: Problems deleting filters with subscribers

fields.description:
SubTasks are not moved correctly if the parent issue is moved to a project with a different security level.

The subtask retains the old security level setting and is not accessible  - it appears in the issue navigator but is not displayed as a subtask of the parent issue.

Need to ensure the security level matches the parent issue.
fields.summary: SubTasks are not moved correctly if the parent issue is moved to a project with a different security level.

fields.description:
Here is a list of translations "problems" I noticed for the french translation of jira 3.0:

* tooltip on general help not translated
* Issue types and priority not translated
* Capital letters not accented (I think they should, but that could be a regionalism)
* In issue creation, "Contexte" could be used instead of "Environment"
* In issue details:
   - the date shows "Today"
   - All    -> Tous
   - Emails -> Courriels
   - Status -> Statut
   - (Not sure about this one :) Workflow -> Flux des interventions
   - Clone -> Dupliquer
* Workflow actions not translated in issue details
* Description of "Vote" not translated
* Untranslated text :
   "There are no entries against this issue."
   "There are no emails on this issue."
* When entering a comment:
   - Comment by -> Commentaire de la part de
   - Delete -> Détruire
* "Clone" screen not translated
* "Add attachment" screen not translated
fields.summary: Missings french translations and typos

fields.description:
The index is easily corrupted and therfore needs to be reindex.  One example when the index gets corrupted is when the server is shutdown while running a jelly script to update/create issues.  

The index should have be self aware.  When the statistics don't match the index contents, then the system should go into repair mode where all queries fall back to the db while the system reindexes itself.
fields.summary: Index easily corrupted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-4586].
  {panel}

> The CVS integration in Jira 3 Preview has improved a lot and now it can be 
> considered finally usable when one has more than just a couple of source 
> files (tested the Professional Standalone version) !
> 
> But it only works nicely if the 'CVS modules' are simple directories in the 
> repository. Unfortunately we have been exploiting quite heavily a standard 
> feature of CVS called 'alias modules' and this gives now the new Jira CVS 
> integration a headache.
> 
> To simplify it when we checkout a single module 'env_projectx' it is 
> actually an alias module which collects things on the server side and comes 
> out in physical files as
> root/struct_common
> root/struct_projectx
> ...
> 
> and still having the correct direct CVS repository details of the server 
> directories in the local configuration files of the 'CVS' subdirectories. 
> Note that this 'root' directory doesn't even exist in the 'log files' of 
> CVS.
> 
> So the problem now is that when I try to set the Jira's CVS integration the 
> following happens:
> 
> "Error parsing cvs log: RCS filename 
> '/opt/master/struct_common/.cvsignore,v' does not start with the provided 
> root '/opt/master/env_pdm' "
> 
> '/opt/master' is the end part of CVSROOT and 'env_pdm' is the alias module
> 
> In other words could there be an optional extra parameter that Jira would 
> use to match against the 'cvs log' command's output instead of assuming 
> that it's always the end part of CVSROOT + the given module name: 
> '/opt/master' + 'env_pdm' = '/opt/master/env_pdm' ??
fields.summary: CVS integration does not work with aliased modules
